Submodules

demesstify.errors module

Contains custom errors.

exception demesstify.errors.CloudNotGeneratedError

Bases: Exception

An exception that is thrown when trying to access something that requires a wordcloud to be generated first.

exception demesstify.errors.ReactionNameError(invalid_name: str, all_names: list[str])

Bases: Exception

An exception that is thrown when an invalid reaction name is used.

demesstify.parse module

Provides functionality for parsing and analyzing an iMessage conversation.

class demesstify.parse.Direction(value)

Bases: Enum

Enumeration for valid message sending directionality.

ALL = 'all'
RECEIVED = 'received'
SENT = 'sent'
class demesstify.parse.Messages(path: Optional[str] = None, source: Union[str, Source] = Source.IMESSAGE_DB, **kwargs)

Bases: object

The main object to handle message data.

as_string(which: Union[str, Direction] = Direction.ALL, include_reactions: bool = False) → str

Gets the message data as a string, separated by new lines.

classmethod from_imessage_csv(path: str) → Messages

Initializes a Messages object using an iMessage CSV file.

classmethod from_imessage_db(path: Optional[str] = None, **kwargs) → Messages

Initializes a Messages object using the local iMessage database.

classmethod from_random(**kwargs) → Messages

Initializes a Messages object using randomly generated dummy text.

For kwarg information, see the generate_sample_text function of the demesstify.testing.messages module.

classmethod from_tansee(path: str) → Messages

Initializes a Messages object using a Tansee text file.

get(which: Union[str, Direction] = Direction.ALL) → DataFrame

Gets the message dataframe.

get_all() → DataFrame

Gets the unfiltered main dataframe.

get_received() → DataFrame

Gets the main dataframe filtered by received messages.

get_sent() → DataFrame

Gets the main dataframe filtered by sent messages.

trim(start: str, end: str, replace: bool = True) → DataFrame

Trims the data to messages sent between a specified time interval.

The start and end arguments generally should follow one of the following previoulsly-tested formats:

%Y-%m-%d %H:%M:%S %Y-%m-%d

That said, other formats may work.

Bases: ABC

Parses the input messages and converts into a standardized form.

Parses the input and outputs it in a standardized form.

Parses a dummy text file.

For kwarg information, see the generate_sample_text function of the demesstify.testing.messages module.

Cleans the input text and separates into lines.

get() → DataFrame

Gets the standardized dataframe.

load() → str

Loads and returns the data from the source.

standardize(lines: list[Any]) → DataFrame

Standardizes the given lines of text.

Converts the given lines of (presumably cleaned) text into a dataframe that follows a standardized format.

class demesstify.parse.iMessageCSV(path: str, delimiter: str = ',')

Bases: Parser

Parses an iMessage csv.

Parses a csv file that was generated by querying the local iMessage database (chat.db).

The csv file should only have three columns:

date, is_from_me, text

All of these columns come from the message table of the database. It is also assumed that there is a header in this csv file.

clean(text: str) → list[Any]

Cleans the input csv text and separates into lines.

get() → DataFrame

Gets the standardized dataframe.

load() → str

Loads the csv file and returns the data as a string.

standardize(lines: list[Any]) → DataFrame

Standardizes the given lines of text.

class demesstify.parse.iMessageDB(path: Optional[str] = None, handle_id: Optional[int] = None, phone: Optional[str] = None, email: Optional[str] = None)

Bases: iMessageCSV

Parses results from a query to the local iMessage database.

load() → str

Loads the csv file and returns the data as a string.
